Module com.demo.lab5
Package com.demo.lab5.shapes

Class ShapeComponentView<TargetShape extends javafx.scene.shape.Shape>

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
com.demo.lab5.shapes.ShapeComponentView<TargetShape>
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
DraggingCreatedShapeComponentView, PolygonComponentView
public abstract class ShapeComponentView<TargetShape extends javafx.scene.shape.Shape> extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane
Base class for all shape components. It provides basic UI config, dragging, rotation, selection and resizing.

  • Property Summary

    Methods inherited from interface javafx.css.Styleable

  • Field Details

    • shape

      protected final TargetShape extends javafx.scene.shape.Shape shape
      Configured JavaFX shape

    • startCoords

      protected final Coordinates startCoords
      Coordinates of the shape when it was created. Used for resizing and dragging.

    • stateManager

      protected DrawingPaneStateManager stateManager
      Reference to the DrawingPaneStateManager which is used to manage and share state between different shapes.
      See Also:
      • DrawingPaneStateManager

    • toolbar

      private ShapeToolbarComponentView toolbar
      Shape toolbar. Null if shape is not selected.
      See Also:
      • ShapeToolbarComponentView

    • draggingOffset

      private Coordinates draggingOffset
      Coordinates of the point where dragging started relative to this `Pane`. Used only for dragging. If dragging is not in progress this field is null.

  • Constructor Details

    • ShapeComponentView

      protected ShapeComponentView(TargetShape shape, double x, double y)
      Constructs a new shape from the given shape and coords.
      Parameters:
      shape - target shape
      x - x start coordinate
      y - y start coordinate

  • Method Details

    • resize

      public abstract void resize(double multiplier)
      Updates the size of the shape. This method is called when the mouse is dragged. It must be implemented differently for each shape, in order to avoid using `scaleX()` and `scaleY()` methods.
      Parameters:
      multiplier - multiplier for the size of the shape

    • draw

      public void draw()
      Initializes and draws the shape. Adds listeners for required events.

    • isSelected

      public boolean isSelected()
      Checks if shape is currently selected using DrawingPaneStateManager.
      Returns:
      true if shape is selected, false otherwise

    • selectedListener

      private void selectedListener(ShapeComponentView<?> selected)
      Listener for a new shape selection. If different shape is selected it removes the toolbar and sets the cursor to default.
      Parameters:
      selected - newly shape

    • setStateManager

      public void setStateManager(DrawingPaneStateManager stateManager)
      Used to set the shared state manager. It should be used **instantly** after the shape is created. State manager will be later used to handle selection, resizing etc.
      Parameters:
      stateManager - state manager to be set

    • getTargetShape

      public TargetShape getTargetShape()

    • onMouseClicked

      public void onMouseClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      This method handle `onMouseClicked` event. It selects current shape and shows the toolbar.
      Parameters:
      event - mouse event

    • onScroll

      public void onScroll(javafx.scene.input.ScrollEvent event)
      This method handles `onScroll` event. It resizes the shape using abstract `resize()` method.
      Parameters:
      event - scroll event

    • onMousePressed

      public void onMousePressed(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      `onMousePressed` events starts dragging if shape is currently selected. Does nothing otherwise.
      Parameters:
      event - mouse event

    • onMouseDragged

      public void onMouseDragged(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Continues and updates shape dragging if it is in progress. Otherwise does nothing.
      Parameters:
      event - mouse event

    • onMouseReleased

      public void onMouseReleased(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Finishes dragging if is in progress. Otherwise, does nothing.
      Parameters:
      event - mouse event
